newsitem.title: UK: IPE Brent makes determined bid for highs.
newsitem.headline: IPE Brent makes determined bid for highs.

text.p: IPE Brent futures wasted no time taking a lead from a stronger NYMEX and made a determined effort to test higher levels by mid-afternoon, having firmed earlier in the day on stronger gas oil.
October Brent was up 37 cents at $20.57 a barrel at 1430 GMT. A futures trader said the contract could test $20.80/90 later in the day.

"We took a lead this morning in Europe. That's what gave the market strength. NYMEX followed it up and buyers on Brent will buy it up if given confirmation from the States, which we are getting," the trader said.
"It was a typical technically-led rally to fill a gap on the NYMEX and Brent is riding its coattails. There's no fundamentals behind it," a broker said.

The trader said there was also a gap on gas oil up to $191.75 a tonne. September gas oil opened lower, then picked up steam, gaining $1.50 on the day in the afternoon session to trade at $189.50 a tonne. -- London newsroom +44 171 542 4088
